newsitem.title: GREECE: Greek Ionian Bank 96 profit falls sharply.
newsitem.headline: Greek Ionian Bank 96 profit falls sharply.

text.p: Ionian Bank's earnings before taxes and provisions fell to 5.0 billion drachmas in 1996 from 16.5 billion in 1995, it said in a statement.
Its after-tax and provisions profit dropped to 2.1 billion drachmas in 1996 from 13.6 billion in 1995, it added.

But its chairman, Harris Stamatopoulos, said profits more than doubled in the first quarter of 1997 compared to the same period in 1996 and went on to predict that this trend would continue this year.
The growth of operating expenses has been contained and revenues from interest and commissions have risen in the first quarter of this year accounting for the increase in profits.
Stamatopoulos will propose to the board and the general assembly a three-for-10 bonus issue.

Stamatopoulos attributed the sharp decline in 1996 pre-tax to higher operating expenditures, lower interest revenues and commissions and a huge write-off of bad loans amounting to 18.6 billion drachmas during the year.
